SEARCH
Package pointOfSales

Class orderPageController

java.lang.Object
pointOfSales.orderPageController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class orderPageController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The orderPageController class is the logic class for the checkoutPage. This class handles all the ordering in the checkoutPage.
Since:
v0.0.2

    • handleChangeScene

      public void handleChangeScene(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The function handleChangeScene is the handler for the logout button. This function resets the current employee and changes back to the loginPage scene.
      Parameters:
      event - used to confirm the logoutButton was pressed.
      See Also:
      • sceneController.changeScene(Scene)

      public void setUpTeaPane()

      public void handleCloseButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

    • checkToggledButton

      public String checkToggledButton(javafx.scene.control.ToggleGroup toggleGroup)
      The checkToggledButton function checks whether or not a toggleGroup has a toggle that is selected.
      Parameters:
      toggleGroup - The toggleGroup that is currently being checked to see what is selected.
      Returns:
      a value of type String that is the text of the button that is currently toggled, or an empty string if nothing is toggled.

    • addItem

      public void addItem(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The addItem function adds the customized item to the checkoutTable. It also creates a orderedProduct to add to an array keeping track of all customizations to the product.
      See Also:
      • checkToggledButton(ToggleGroup)
      • orderedProduct.setIce(String)
      • orderedProduct.setSugar(Double)
      • orderedProduct.setNote(String)
      • orderedProduct.addToList(String)

    • handleCancelButton

      public void handleCancelButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The handleCancelButton function clears all relevant variables, labels, and tables. So the next order starts off as if no order was made before it.

    • handleToppingButtons

      public void handleToppingButtons(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The handleToppingButtons function dynamically changes the price displayed in the UI when you click and unclick the buttons.
      Parameters:
      event - used to check if the source button is selected

    • handleProceedButton

      public void handleProceedButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The handleProceedButton function is the handler for the proceed button. This function grabs all the information about the current order and passes it to the backend to add the order to the database.
      See Also:
      • loginPageController.getFirstName()
      • loginPageController.getLastName()

    • checkoutButton

      public void checkoutButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The checkoutButton function is the handler for the checkout button on the sidebar. This function turns the visibilty of all other UI elements off and all of the UI for the checkout menu on. The function also clears any left over values in the table that may be there before navigating off the checkout menu.
      See Also:
      • setUpTeaPane()

    • initializeOrderHistoryTable

      public void initializeOrderHistoryTable()
      The initializeOrderHistoryTable function initializes the orderHistory table so data can be added to it.

    • handleOrdersButton

      public void handleOrdersButton()
      The handleOrdersButton is the handler for the orders button on the right nav bar. This function toggles the visibility of all UI elements not on that page off and toggles on all the UI elements that are on the page. It also initializes the tables on the page.
      See Also:
      • initializeOrderHistoryTable()
      • initializeHistoryInfoTable()

    • handleGenerateOrderHistory

      public void handleGenerateOrderHistory()
      The handleGenerateOrderHistory function is the handler for the generate button on the orders page. This function takes a date window and adds 25 orders to the orderHistory table.
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.getOrdersByDates(String, String)

    • handleForwardHistory

      public void handleForwardHistory()
      The handleForwardHistory function is the handler for the next button on the orders page. This function grabs the next 1 <= x <= 25 values from the array that was generated by handleGenerateOrderHistory. Then it clears the table and displays the next 25 values.

    • handleBackwardHistory

      public void handleBackwardHistory()
      The handleBackwardHistory function is the handler for the prev button on the orders page. This function grabs the previous 25 values and loads them into the table.

    • initializeHistoryInfoTable

      public void initializeHistoryInfoTable()
      The initializeHistoryInfoTable function initializes the historyInfoTable so values can be added to it.

    • handleHistoryTableClick

      public void handleHistoryTableClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      The handleHistoryTableClick function is the handler the order history table. This function whenever a row is selected on the table, it adds the details of the order to the order history info table to show what was ordered and how much it cost.
      Parameters:
      event - is used to make sure that a row was clicked
      See Also:
      • SystemFunctions.getOrderProductByID(Integer)
